https://gispub.epa.gov/airnow/index.html.Description: The AirNow Interactive Map is an interactive map of air quality that includes data for air quality monitors in the US, Canada, and Mexico. The map allows users to select layers from the dropdown panels, select geographic outlines, and view the air quality index (AQI) legend. Users can also click on a monitor to reveal NowCast AQI and raw concentration data, and download images and data from the chart's menu. The map is updated periodically to show the most recent data.

https://www.airnow.gov/index.cfm?action=.Description: The AirNow API provides access to current, forecast, and historical air quality index (AQI) data for over 500 cities across the US, Canada, and Mexico. The AQI is a measure of how clean or polluted the air is and the associated health effects. The API also provides ozone and particle pollution data.

https://doi.org/10.7927/fx80-4n39.Description: The Global Annual PM2.5 Grids from MODIS, MISR, and SeaWiFS Aerosol Optical Depth (AOD) dataset shows annual concentrations of fine particulate matter (PM2.5) on a global scale. These data may be useful in health and air quality research.

https://doi.org/10.7927/rja8-8h89.Description: The Annual PM2.5 Concentrations for Countries and Urban Areas dataset shows the average concentration of particulate matter (PM2.5) in countries and urban areas. PM2.5 can affect human health, and this dataset can be used for health and environmental research.

https://doi.org/10.7927/0rvr-4538.Description: The Daily and Annual PM2.5 Concentrations for the Contiguous United States 1km Grids dataset provides daily and annual PM2.5 concentration data for the contiguous United States. These data may be useful in public health research to estimate short and long-term effects on human health.

https://doi.org/10.7927/a4mb-4t86.Description: The Daily 8-Hour Maximum and Annual O3 Concentrations for the Contiguous United States 1-km Grids dataset contains estimates of ozone concentrations at a high resolution in space (1 km x 1 km grid cells) and time (daily) for the years 2000 to 2016. These predictions incorporated various predictor variables such as Ozone (O3) ground measurements from the US Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) Air Quality System (AQS) monitoring data, land-use variables, meteorological variables, chemical transport models, and remote sensing data, along with other data sources. After imputing missing data with machine learning algorithms, a geographically weighted ensemble model was applied that combined estimates from three types of machine learners: neural network, random forest, and gradient boosting. The annual predictions were computed by averaging the daily 8-hour maximum predictions in each year for each grid cell. The results demonstrate high overall model performance with a cross-validated R-squared value against daily observations of 0.90 and 0.86 for annual averages.
https://doi.org/10.7927/a4mb-4t86.Project: Air Quality Data for Health-Related Applications

https://doi.org/10.7927/weq9-pv30.Description: The Global Pesticide Grids, PESTCHEMGRIDS, v1 (2015 - 2020 - 2025) dataset contains 20 of the most-used pesticide active ingredients on 6 dominant crops and 4 aggregated crop classes at 5 arc-minute resolution (about 10 km at the equator) estimated in year 2015 and then projected to 2020 and 2025. These data may be useful in assessing human and ecosystem exposure to potential toxicants for environmental modeling, assessment of agricultural chemical contamination and risk analysis, and other related research at global, regional, national, and local levels.
https://doi.org/10.7927/weq9-pv30.Project: PESTCHEMGRIDS - Global Gridded Maps of the Top 20 Crop-specific Pesticide Application Rates from 2015 to 2025

https://search.earthdata.nasa.gov/search.Description: The MOPITT (Measurements of Pollution in the Troposphere) dataset provides global carbon monoxide (CO) measurements, which can be used to monitor air quality and pollution. These data can be useful for studying air quality and pollution in urban areas.
https://search.earthdata.nasa.gov/search.Project: MOPITT - Measurements Of Pollution In The Troposphere

https://search.earthdata.nasa.gov/search.Description: The MOPITT (Measurements of Pollution in the Troposphere) dataset provides daily global carbon monoxide (CO) measurements. CO is a pollutant that can have harmful effects on human health and is a precursor to the formation of ground-level ozone, a criteria air pollutant. These data can be used to monitor air quality and aid in forecasting air pollution events.

https://dx.doi.org/10.5067/Aura/OMI/DATA.Description: The Global Flood Monitoring System (GFMS) is a prototype system that provides real-time flood detection and streamflow estimates. The system uses real-time satellite precipitation data, real-time streamflow data, and a global hydrological model to provide real-time flood detection and streamflow estimates.

The Global Flood Monitoring System (GFMS) is a prototype system that provides real-time flood detection and streamflow estimates. The system uses real-time satellite precipitation data, real-time streamflow data, and a global hydrological model to provide real-time flood detection and streamflow estimates.

https://aeronet.gsfc.nasa.gov/cgi-bin/dr.Description: The AErosol RObotic NETwork (AERONET) Data Display tool provides access to data from AERONET's sun photometer network. These data can be used to study aerosol optical properties and their impact on air quality, climate, and human health.

https://doi.org/10.7927/H4ZK5DQS.Description: The Global Annual PM2.5 Grids from MODIS, MISR, and SeaWiFS Aerosol Optical Depth (AOD) with GWR, v1 (1998 \\u2013 2016) dataset shows the annual average concentration of particulate matter less than 2.5 micrometers in diameter (PM2.5) in the air. These data may be useful in health and air quality research.

https://data.worldbank.org/indicator/EN..Description: The Global Burden of Disease (GBD) Study is a comprehensive effort to quantify human health impacts of exposure to outdoor air pollution. The GBD Study provides annual average population-weighted mean PM2.5 (particulate matter less than 2.5 micrometers in diameter) air pollution exposure estimates. These estimates are available for the years 1990-2019 and are measured in micrograms per cubic meter. PM2.5 air pollution exposure is associated with a variety of adverse health outcomes, including respiratory and cardiovascular diseases. These data can be used to assess the health impacts of air pollution exposure and to inform public health policy and research.

https://dx.doi.org/10.5067/Aura/OMI/DATA.Description: The Global Flood Monitoring System (GFMS) is a prototype system that provides real-time flood detection and streamflow estimates. The system uses real-time satellite precipitation data, real-time streamflow data, and a global hydrological model to provide real-time flood detection and streamflow estimates.

https://so2.gsfc.nasa.gov/.Description: The Global Sulfur Dioxide Monitoring dataset provides near real-time monitoring of sulfur dioxide (SO2) emissions from volcanic eruptions and anthropogenic sources. These data can be used to monitor air quality and pollution levels.

https://dx.doi.org/10.5270/S5P-hcp1l2m.Description: The Sentinel-5P TROPOMI Level 2 Tropospheric Ozone dataset provides data on tropospheric ozone columns in the tropical region. Tropospheric ozone plays a role in air quality and human health, and can be transported over long distances.

https://search.earthdata.nasa.gov/search.Description: The MOPITT (Measurements of Pollution in the Troposphere) dataset provides daily global carbon monoxide (CO) measurements. CO is a pollutant that can have harmful effects on human health and is a precursor to the formation of ground-level ozone, a criteria air pollutant. These data can be used to monitor air quality and aid in forecasting air pollution events.

http://www.tropomi.eu/data-products/uv-a.Description: The TROPOMI (TROPOspheric Monitoring Instrument) dataset provides information on air quality, including nitrogen dioxide, ozone, formaldehyde, sulfur dioxide, carbon monoxide, and aerosols. These data can be used to monitor air quality and public health.

https://doi.org/10.5067/40L92G8144IV.Description: The Global Flood Monitoring System (GFMS) is a prototype system that provides real-time flood detection and streamflow estimates. The system uses real-time satellite precipitation data, real-time streamflow data, and a global hydrological model to provide real-time flood detection and streamflow estimates.

https://doi.org/10.5067/MOQOVNHNERGG.Description: The Global Flood Monitoring System (GFMS) is a prototype system that provides real-time flood detection and streamflow estimates. The system uses real-time satellite precipitation data, real-time streamflow data, and a global hydrological model to provide real-time flood detection and streamflow estimates.

https://dx.doi.org/10.5067/MODIS/MCD43GF.Description: The MCD43GF V006 MODIS/Terra+Aqua BRDF/Albedo Gap-Filled Snow-Free Daily L3 Global 30 Arc-Second CMG data product is a daily 30 arc-second product that provides information on the reflectance of the Earth's surface. These data may be useful in climate change research.

https://doi.org/10.5067/VIIRS/AERDB_L2_V.Description: The VIIRS (Visible Infrared Imaging Radiometer Suite) <NAME> Aerosol product uses the <NAME> DB algorithm over land and Satellite Ocean Aerosol Retrieval (SOAR) algorithm over water to determine atmospheric aerosol loading for daytime, cloud-free, snow-free scenes. These data are designed to facilitate continuity in the aerosol record provided by the <NAME> Aerosol project for other sensors, including the Sea-viewing Wide Field-of-view Sensor (SeaWiFS) and Terra/Aqua Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometers (MODIS).
https://doi.org/10.5067/VIIRS/AERDB_L2_V.Project: VIIRS (Visible Infrared Imaging Radiometer Suite) <NAME> Aerosol

https://disc.gsfc.nasa.gov/datacollectio.Description: The MOPITT (Measurements of Pollution in the Troposphere) product provides data on carbon monoxide in the atmosphere. Carbon monoxide is a pollutant that can affect air quality and human health. These data can be used to study air quality and pollution.

https://go.nasa.gov/2IDvag7.Description: The EOSDIS Worldview application provides the capability to interactively browse global, full-resolution satellite imagery and then download the underlying data. Most of the 200+ available products are updated within three hours of observation, essentially showing the entire Earth as it looks

https://dx.doi.org/10.5067/MODIS/MYD14.0.Description: The MYD14 (Aqua) Thermal Anomalies/Fire 5-Min L2 Swath 1km V6 product is a daily, 5-minute product that can be used to identify fires and other thermal anomalies such as volcanoes. These data can aid in monitoring natural disasters and other catastrophic events.
